intro: Dicranostyles guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, characterized by a leafy, flat body that is often covered in small, scale-like structures. It plays a vital role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats. Dicranostyles guianensis is also an indicator species for undisturbed forest ecosystems.
